intro: Herpestis elongata, commonly known as the slender bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. The fruit is a pod that contains several small, round seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
